DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time when acquisition of data resulting in this image started, displayed in the format hhmmss.frac; where hh (00-23); minutes (00-59); seconds (00-59); frac=fractional part "000000"-"999999". The Acquisition Time (0008,0032) use the same time base as Series Time (0008,0031) for PET Series images.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The time when acquisition of data that resulted in this image started.  The Acquisition Time (0008,0032) use the same time base as Series Time (0008,0031) for PET Series images.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.:Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/16/10 definition updated per VCDE small group review.  1/3/2010 added "start" concept to fully capture the semantics of the definition. 10/22/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  5/20/07-2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 3

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: TM:  DICOM Time; A string of characters of the format hhmmss.frac; where hh (00-23); minutes (00-59); seconds (00-59); frac=fractional part "000000"-"999999"

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI. jc  7/10/11 add text short name.  5/16/10 definition updated per VCDE small group review.  4/27/10 add to CRF CSI.   1/3/2010 - CDE versioned to capture "start" in the semantics.  12/16/09 - chg reg status to Proposed  12/9/09 upd pref question text to make OC.  1/6/09 - released CDE for use in C3D application; still to be updated for NCIA silver changes but will be versioned at that time.  6/24/07 -CDE updated to support DICOM CDE IE - DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.  3/22/07 - Assigned CDEs to DICOM-Review Set 1 CSI
